alert.note: Alert for Allen; Beauregard; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 7:58PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CAMERON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON DAVIS...SOUTHEASTERN BEAUREGARD...CALCASIEU...SOUTHERN ALLEN PARISHES IN SOUTHWESTERN LOUISIANA AND EASTERN ORANGE COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CST... At 758 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Topsy to Port Neches. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Sulphur, Orange, Bridge City, Westlake, West Orange, Vinton, Iowa, Kinder, Elton, Fenton, Moss Bluff, De Quincy, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Starks, Lunita, Topsy, Toomey, Lebleu Settlement, and Gillis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 880 and 869. Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 52. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Beauregard; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; West Cameron
